titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting motions for consolidation of cases. Case number 8:09CV157, filing nos. 36, 37, and 38; case number 4:10CV3020, filing nos. 6, 7, and 8; and case number 4:10CV3021, filing nos. 6, 7, and 8, are granted. Case number 8:09CV157, OMeara, et. al. v. Heineman, et. al. is hereby designated as the "Lead Case." The remaining cases, (4:10CV3020 and 4:10CV3021) are hereby designated as the "Member Cases." On or before March 10, 2010, the defendants shall answer or otherwise respond to the plaintiffs' complaints. The Rule 26(f) Report of Parties' Planning Conference shall be filed on or before April 2, 2010. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JAB)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:10-cv-03020; Sires v. Heineman et al;

extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting motions for consolidation of cases. Case number 8:09CV157, filing nos. 36, 37, and 38; case number 4:10CV3020, filing nos. 6, 7, and 8; and case number 4:10CV3021, filing nos. 6, 7, and 8, are granted. Case number 8:09CV157, OMeara, et. al. v. Heineman, et. al. is hereby designated as the "Lead Case." The remaining cases, (4:10CV3020 and 4:10CV3021) are hereby designated as the "Member Cases." On or before March 10, 2010, the defendants shall answer or otherwise respond to the plaintiffs' complaints. titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The motion to dismiss (filing 41 in Case No. 8:09CV157, filing 11 in Case No. 8:10CV3020 and filing 11 in Case No. 8:10CV3021) is granted.The claims against Defendant Clare E. Mahon brought by Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts are hereby dismissed without prejudice or limitations to these Plaintiffs' claims against the remaining Defendants and are dismissed without prejudice to re-filing against Mahon. Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts' claims against the other Defendants remain pending. The Clerk of the United States District Court for the District of Nebraska shall adjust the court's computerized record-keeping system to reflect the dismissal of Clare E. Mahon. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (TCL )

Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts' claims against the other Defendants remain pending. titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL PROGRESSION ORDER - No telephonic planning conference will be held to discuss the progression of this case to trial. On the contrary, a final progression order is now issued as set forth in the following paragraph: The Motion to Amend 45 in case 8:09-cv-00157 is granted. Jury Trial set for 3/7/2011 before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Pretrial Conference set for 2/17/2011 at 1:00 PM before Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. Depositions due 11/1/2010. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JSF)

titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting (48) Motion to Extend Deadline in case 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ; granting (19) Motion to Extend in case 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ; granting (18) Motion to Extend in case 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ. The defendants' deadline for filing a motion for summary judgment on the basis of qualified immunity is continued to July 1, 2010. titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 50) Motion to Stay in case 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ; granting 21 Motion to Stay in case 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ; granting 20 Motion to Stay in case 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ without prejudice to the plaintiffs filing a properly supported motion to conduct limited discovery to address the issue of qualified immunity. If, after a ruling on the anticipated summary judgment, this case is not dismissed in its entirety, the parties shall contact the undersigned's chambers, within 10 days of the summary judgment ruling to discuss necessary amendments, if any, to the Final Progression Order. If the defendants do not file the anticipated motion for summary judgment, discovery will resume pursuant to the Final Progression Order. The clerk shall file this memorandum and order in the lead case, 8:09-cv-00157, and spread the text and order to the member cases. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (GJG )

titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 31 Defendant's Motion to Seal. Defendants' brief in Support of Motion for Summary Judgment (filing 28) and Defendants' Evidence Index in Support of Motion for Summary Judgment and the attached evidence (filing 30) are hereby placed under seal and access is restricted to the court and the parties to this action, including counsel of record. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: below; Plaintiffs' response deadline for the motions for summary judgment are stayed until a date to be determined after the court has considered and ruled upon Plaintiffs' motions to conduct limited discovery (Case No. 8:09CV157, filing 63; Case No. 4:10CV3020, filing 35; Case No. 4:10CV3021, filing 34). titleInfo.title: Sires v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting (67) Motion to Extend in case 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ. The Plaintiffs deadline for disclosure of experts is extended to 60 days after this Courts ruling on the Defendants Motion for Summary Judgment on the issue of qualified immunity. Within ten days following the courts decision on qualified immunity, the parties shall contact the chambers of the undersigned to schedule a conference call to discuss the progression schedule for this case to trial. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (CRZ, )
